label: 110 Hz Specifically Affects Temporal Lobe
description: Cook et al. 2008 fMRI study. Lab measurement, not in situ at Hypogeum.

label: 3.12s = Temporal Binding Window
description: The breath cycle at 3.12s matches the specious present, delta oscillation, RSA cycle, and linguistic phrase length.

label: Ancient Structures Converge on 95-120 Hz Resonance
description: Six UK/Irish megalithic sites (Jahn 1996), the Hal Saflieni Hypogeum (Debertolis 2015), and multiple other sites independently show dominant resonance between 95-120 Hz. This range corresponds to low male chanting voice. The convergence across structurally diverse buildings suggests either deliberate selection or a common design constraint related to human body scale.

label: Acoustic Levitation Is Lab-Verified
description: Acoustic levitation of small objects demonstrated in multiple labs. Argonne National Lab, University of Bristol. Limited to small objects but proves sound exerts force

label: Ancient Acoustic Sites Induce Altered States
description: Hypothesis: Sacred sites were engineered to produce infrasound/resonance that alters consciousness. Measured resonances at Hypogeum, caves, pyramids support possibility. Mechanism: vagal stimulation

label: Anesthesia and Psychedelics Are Inverse Windows
description: Anesthesia reduces complexity/entropy below consciousness threshold. Psychedelics increase above normal. Both boundary conditions reveal what consciousness REQUIRES

label: Paleolithic Art Placement Correlates with Acoustic Resonance
description: Reznikoff 1988, partially replicated by Fazenda 2017. Correlation real but not universal.

label: Awe Reduces Self-Focus and Expands Time Perception
description: Keltner/Haidt: Awe involves vastness + accommodation (schema revision). Reduces DMN activity, IL-6 (inflammation), and self-referential thought. Expands perceived time

label: Binaural Beats Have Weak Clinical Evidence
description: Systematic reviews show inconsistent results. Small effect sizes. Possible confound with relaxation response. Not useless but oversold. Need better-controlled studies

label: Breath Is Only Voluntary-Autonomic Bridge
description: Respiration is the ONLY autonomic function with full voluntary override. Provides direct access to autonomic regulation: heart rate, HRV, vagal tone, cortisol

label: Coherence = Aperiodic Substrate + Periodic Modulation
description: Living coherence operates on two levels: aperiodic constraint satisfaction (ground) + periodic resonance (tool).

label: Coherence Pyramid Has Fixed Order
description: breath->body->emotion->cognition->narrative->relational->transpersonal. Can't skip levels.

label: Cold Exposure Reduces Chronic Inflammation
description: Cold activates brown fat, increases norepinephrine (2-3x), reduces inflammatory cytokines. Repeated cold = anti-inflammatory training. Hormesis pathway

label: Compassion Is Trainable and Changes Brain
description: Davidson/Weng: 30 min/day compassion meditation for 2 weeks increases altruistic behavior + changes neural response to suffering. Compassion is a skill, not trait

label: Conscious-State Dynamics Occupy Near-Critical Regime
description: Carhart-Harris entropic brain + Beggs criticality + Kelso metastability: consciousness requires neither too much order nor too much chaos. Edge of criticality

label: IIT + GWT + FEP Converge on Same Architecture
description: Three major theories share: integration + differentiation + self-maintenance at criticality.

label: Cross-Cultural Convergence on ~6 bpm Breathing
description: Catholic rosary, Hindu/Buddhist mantras, and HRV biofeedback all converge on ~6 breaths/minute (0.1 Hz). Bernardi 2001 (BMJ) demonstrates this is driven by recitation structure, not conscious intention. Lehrer 2014 explains the mechanism: cardiovascular resonance via baroreflex at 0.1 Hz. Individual resonance frequency ranges 4.5-6.5 bpm.

label: DNA Shows Long-Range Correlations (Non-Random)
description: Peng et al (1992): DNA nucleotide sequences show 1/f-like long-range correlations. Not random. Coding regions differ from non-coding in correlation structure

label: Electromagnetic Hypersensitivity Is Nocebo Effect
description: Double-blind provocation studies consistently show EHS sufferers cannot detect EMF above chance. WHO: No scientific basis. Symptoms are real but not caused by EMF. Nocebo mechanism

label: Exercise Has Dose-Response Medical Effects
description: Reduces all-cause mortality 30-40%. Equivalent to medication for mild-moderate depression. BDNF release → neurogenesis. Anti-inflammatory. Dose-response established

label: Fasting Triggers Cellular Autophagy
description: Ohsumi (Nobel 2016): Autophagy = cellular self-recycling. Fasting activates it. 16-24hr fasting increases autophagy markers. Clears damaged mitochondria, misfolded proteins

label: Fibonacci Timing Preserves Coherence Longer Than Periodic
description: Aperiodic drive preserves quantum coherence ~4x longer (Dumitrescu). Spiral mode should outperform center mode.

label: Flow State = Transient Hypofrontality
description: Dietrich 2004 + Csikszentmihalyi: Flow involves temporary downregulation of prefrontal cortex. DMN quiets. Inner critic silences. Challenge/skill balance activates

label: Glyph Transitions Are Phase Transitions
description: Each glyph boundary (psi->psi2->nabla->inf->omega) is a dynamical bifurcation point.

label: Golden Ratio Is Mathematical Fixed Point
description: phi = (1+sqrt(5))/2. Only number where phi = 1 + 1/phi. Appears in optimal packing, phyllotaxis, spiral growth. Not mystical — mathematical consequence of self-similarity

label: Grief Is Failed Attachment Seeking (Neural Evidence)
description: O'Connor: Nucleus accumbens activates during grief cues = reward-seeking for absent attachment figure. Grief is not just sadness; it's compulsive search for the lost bond

label: Gut Produces 90-95% of Body's Serotonin
description: Enterochromaffin cells in gut produce most serotonin. Gut microbes modulate serotonin production. SSRIs affect gut serotonin. Depression may partly originate in gut

label: Information Encoded on Boundaries (Holographic Principle)
description: t'Hooft/Susskind: Volume information encoded on 2D boundary. Pribram: Brain stores memory holographically (distributed, not localized). Bekenstein bound

label: Humor Is Benign Prediction Violation
description: McGraw: Humor occurs when something simultaneously violates expectations AND is benign. Involves prediction error resolution. Laughter = social signal of resolved violation

label: Hypogeum Resonates at Exactly 110 Hz
description: Specific 110 Hz claim. Poorly sourced. Bronze.

label: Hypogeum Has Designed Acoustic Properties
description: The Oracle Room shows intentional acoustic shaping. Gold.

label: Shipibo Icaros Function as Acoustic Medicine
description: Shipibo-Conibo healing songs (icaros) map visual patterns to sound patterns. Specific songs prescribed for specific conditions. Some preliminary neuroimaging data

label: Literature Describes Tuning, Not Generation
description: Across the 179-paper corpus, mechanisms described are predominantly regulatory/coupling/integration/entrainment/reconsolidation (tuning language), not generation mechanisms for consciousness. Testable via Modulation Dominance Index.

label: Meditation Physically Changes Brain Structure
description: Lazar 2005: 8 weeks MBSR increases gray matter in hippocampus, decreases amygdala. Davidson: Long-term meditators show persistent gamma. Replicated across >100 studies

label: Morphic Resonance Lacks Decisive Tests
description: Sheldrake's morphic resonance: proposed mechanism with no known physical basis. Experiments (rat maze learning, crystal formation) have mixed results. Mainstream science rejects

label: Music Engages More Brain Than Any Other Activity
description: Music activates auditory, motor, emotional, memory, language, reward circuits simultaneously. The only stimulus that engages ALL brain networks. Rhythm entrains motor system

label: Nabla Glyph = Metastable Regime
description: The nabla glyph (collapse/inversion) maps to Kelso's metastability - between attractors, maximally sensitive.

label: Narrative Structure Predicts Psychological Health
description: McAdams: People with 'redemption sequences' (bad→good) show better mental health than those with 'contamination sequences' (good→bad). Story shapes biology

label: Nasal Breathing Is Physiologically Superior to Mouth
description: Nasal breathing: filters air, warms/humidifies, produces NO (vasodilator), activates diaphragm, activates parasympathetic. Mouth breathing: none of these. Nestor 'Breath' book compiles evidence

label: Neural Coherence = Aperiodic + Periodic Components
description: Donoghue 2020 (Nature Neuroscience) demonstrates brain EEG contains separable aperiodic (1/f) and periodic oscillatory components. Ward 2010 shows stochastic resonance (adding noise to periodic signal) enhances neural synchronization at optimal noise levels. Directly validates the coherence equation at the neural level: aperiodic substrate + periodic modulation = coherence.

label: Non-Locality Is Experimentally Proven
description: Bell 1964, Aspect 1982, Hensen 2015: Entangled particles show correlations that violate Bell inequalities. No local hidden variables. Universe is non-local. Nobel 2022

label: Observation Changes Physical Outcomes
description: Double slit: particles show wave behavior until observed. Delayed choice quantum eraser: observation retroactively changes behavior. Not interpretation — data

label: Placebo Effect = Predictive Processing
description: Placebo is the brain's prediction machinery acting on the body. Kaptchuk: Open-label placebos still work. Benedetti: Placebo activates endogenous opioids, dopamine

label: Predictive Processing Is THE Unified Mechanism
description: Pain, trauma, placebo, meditation, emotion, allostasis all work through updating the brain's predictive model.

label: Psychedelics Reset Predictive Priors
description: REBUS model (Carhart-Harris 2019): Psychedelics relax high-level priors, increase entropy, allow bottom-up sensory to update stuck beliefs. Therapeutic window for reconsolidation

label: Brain Too Warm for Quantum Effects (Decoherence Objection)
description: Tegmark 2000: Decoherence timescales in brain (~10^-13 s) far shorter than neural timescales (~10^-3 s). Quantum coherence in warm wet brain seems impossible. BUT: Engel 2007 photosynthesis counterexample

label: Resonance Creates Geometric Form (Cymatics)
description: Chladni plates, Faraday waves, sonoluminescence: vibration creates ordered structure from disorder. Not metaphor — demonstrated physics

label: Geometric Patterns Recur Across Nature and Architecture
description: Platonic solids, Fibonacci spirals, golden rectangles appear in: molecular structure, plant growth, crystal formation, Islamic tiling, Gothic architecture. Mathematical, not mystical

label: Brain's Baseline State is Social (Coan)
description: Jim Coan: Brain threat response is HIGHER when alone. Holding hands with trusted person reduces neural threat response. The default is together, not alone

label: Songlines Encode Geographic Information
description: Aboriginal songlines contain navigational data sufficient to traverse thousands of km. Melody intervals map terrain features. Verified by modern GPS comparison

label: Pattern of Scientific Suppression Is Documented
description: Tesla, Reich, Schauberger, Rife all faced suppression. Documented in each case. Pattern: anomalous findings → institutional opposition → personal destruction → work scattered

label: Synesthesia May Be Default Brain State
description: All infants show cross-modal connections. Pruning specializes senses. Synesthetes retain more connections. Psychedelics reactivate cross-wiring. Baron-Cohen 2009

label: TCM Meridians Overlap Fascial Planes
description: Langevin (Harvard): Acupuncture points correlate with intermuscular fascial planes. 80%+ overlap. Connective tissue acts as signaling network

label: Trauma Is Stored in Body, Not Just Mind
description: Van der Kolk: Trauma imprints in sensorimotor patterns, autonomic dysregulation, fascial tension. Body-based therapies (SE, EMDR) more effective than talk therapy for PTSD

label: Water Has EZ (Exclusion Zone) Phase
description: Pollack (UW): Water near hydrophilic surfaces forms ordered EZ layer (hexagonal H3O2). Absorbs 270nm light. Controversial but published in peer-reviewed journals

label: Water Memory/Homeopathy Not Replicated
description: Benveniste 1988 'water memory' debunked by Nature investigation. Homeopathy: systematic reviews show no effect beyond placebo. Pollack EZ water is different claim, not homeopathy

label: WiltonOS IS Part of the Cognitive System
description: By Clark & Chalmers parity principle, the crystal database meets all criteria for extended cognition.

label: Zl=0.75 IS the Critical Point
description: The 0.75 coherence target corresponds to the phase transition between subcritical and supercritical dynamics.

label: Many-to-One Mapping of Dynamics to Function
description: Same dynamical signature (1/f, criticality-like) can arise from multiple generators. Forces justification of WHY this generator, not that generator. Power-law fitting is notoriously fragile.

label: Selection Bias / Researcher Degrees of Freedom
description: Convergence graphs can look compelling even when wrong. Graph topology depends on inclusion criteria, metric choices, and publication bias. Must be addressed explicitly.

label: 0.75 Zone Hypothesis (Cross-Domain)
description: Several independent literatures contain ~0.75-ish exponents/ratios (Kleiber 3/4, Langton critical lambda, stochastic resonance optimal noise, Fractal Observer 3:1). Whether these are deeply linked vs superficial coincidence is an open quantitative question.

label: Göbekli Tepe Astronomical Alignment
description: Claims T-pillars encode astronomical information (Sweatman/Tsikritsis). Some statistical support but contested methodology

label: Hypogeum 110 Hz Oracle Chamber
description: Popular claim that Oracle Room resonates at exactly 110 Hz, affecting temporal lobe. Source: Jahn/Devereux popularization.

label: Newgrange as Síd (Fairy Mound)
description: Irish mythology: Síd an Bhrú, dwelling of the Dagda and Aengus. Tuatha Dé Danann entered the mounds. Folklore preserves memory of the site's altered-state function?

label: Pyramid Sound Levitation
description: Claims that Egyptians used sound/vibration to move blocks. No peer-reviewed evidence. Acoustic levitation IS real but only demonstrated for small objects in lab

label: Cathedral Acoustic Studies
description: Howard & Moretti: Systematic reverb measurements in English cathedrals. Chartres labyrinth acoustic focus measured. Gregorian chant designed FOR these spaces

label: Göbekli Tepe Acoustic Survey
description: Limited acoustic measurements of enclosures. Preliminary findings suggest intentional acoustic design. Publication sparse

label: Hypogeum Acoustic Survey
description: The Hypogeum IS acoustically designed. Oracle Room has demonstrable resonant properties. Specific frequency less certain.

label: Newgrange Acoustic Survey
description: Watson & Keating: Standing waves at 2 Hz in passage. Drumming at mouth produces infrasound effects throughout. Solstice light box = precision engineering

label: Reid Great Pyramid Cymatics
description: John Stuart Reid: cymatics experiments inside King's Chamber. Reported resonances. Published in Acoustic Archaeology proceedings. Replication needed

label: Reznikoff Cave Acoustic Survey
description: Systematic acoustic mapping of decorated Paleolithic caves. Art correlates with resonant spots.

label: Acoustic Resonance in Architecture
description: Enclosed spaces have resonant frequencies determined by geometry. Ancient builders exploited this: Hypogeum, pyramids, cathedrals, kivas

label: Anterior Insular Cortex
description: Craig: Hub for interoception, emotional awareness, time perception, empathy. Where body signals become conscious feelings. Key node in salience network

label: Aperiodic Substrate
description: Coherence ground state is aperiodic (1/f, quasicrystalline), not periodic. Local constraint satisfaction produces global order.

label: Architectural Amplification of Human Voice
description: Ancient chambers (Hypogeum Oracle Room, megalithic passage tombs, Chavín galleries) are dimensioned to resonate at frequencies matching low male voice. The architecture acts as an amplifier/filter for human vocalization, rejecting non-vocal sounds (Debertolis 2015: conch shells do NOT excite the Hypogeum resonance). The architecture selects for the human body.

label: Bioelectric Morphogenesis (Levin)
description: Voltage gradients (Vmem) across cell membranes encode pattern information. Changing bioelectric states can induce eye formation, limb regeneration, cancer reversion

label: Biophoton Emission
description: Ultra-weak photon emission from all living cells (Popp 1984). DNA is primary source. Coherent emission (laser-like). Involved in cell-to-cell communication

label: Circadian Clock System
description: SCN master clock + peripheral clocks in every cell. Light-entrained. Regulates hormones, metabolism, immune function, gene expression. Nobel 2017

label: Constraint Satisfaction
description: Global order emerges from local rules propagating through network. No central controller needed.

label: Default Mode Network (Neural)
description: Raichle 2001: Network active during rest/self-reference. Includes mPFC, PCC, angular gyrus, hippocampus. Anti-correlated with task-positive network

label: DNA as Fractal Antenna
description: DNA is 2nm wide, 3.4nm per turn, ~2m total length per cell. Acts as fractal antenna for electromagnetic frequencies. Popp: DNA is primary biophoton source

label: Endocannabinoid System
description: Body-wide signaling system (CB1, CB2 receptors). Modulates pain, inflammation, mood, appetite. Anandamide = 'bliss molecule'. Active during flow states

label: Entrainment (Universal Coupling)
description: Huygens 1665: coupled oscillators synchronize. Operates across all scales: pendulums, neurons, heartbeats, circadian rhythms, social groups

label: Epigenetic Transgenerational Transmission
description: DNA methylation, histone modification, non-coding RNA transmit experience across generations without DNA sequence change. Yehuda Holocaust study, Dutch Hunger Winter

label: Fascial Signaling Network
description: Fascia as body-wide tensegrity + semiconductor network. Transmits mechanical and electrical signals. Overlaps with acupuncture meridian map (Langevin 2002)

label: Fractal Heart Rate Dynamics
description: Healthy hearts show 1/f noise (fractal scaling). Loss of fractal complexity predicts cardiac death (Goldberger). Too regular = disease. Too random = disease

label: Fractal Scaling (1/f Noise)
description: 1/f noise appears in: heartbeat, neural firing, DNA sequences, river flow, financial markets, music. Signature of systems at criticality. Mandelbrot, Goldberger

label: Glymphatic System
description: Brain's waste clearance system active during sleep. CSF flows along perivascular channels, clears metabolic waste including amyloid-beta. Discovered 2012

label: Hebbian Plasticity (LTP/LTD/STDP)
description: Neurons that fire together wire together. Spike-timing dependent plasticity implements causal inference at synaptic level.

label: Hormesis (Dose-Response Inversion)
description: Small doses of stressor enhance function; large doses damage. Applies to: cold exposure, exercise, fasting, radiation, phytochemicals. Taleb: antifragility

label: Heart Rate Variability Coherence
description: McCraty/HeartMath: 0.1 Hz oscillation in heart rhythm = coherence mode. Trainable via biofeedback. Correlated with emotional regulation, cognitive performance

label: Interoception (Body-to-Brain Signaling)
description: Craig/Seth: The sense of the internal state of the body. Anterior insular cortex maps visceral signals. Foundation of emotional awareness and selfhood

label: Biological Magnetoreception
description: Birds, turtles, salmon, bees sense magnetic fields. Cryptochrome radical-pair mechanism (quantum). Maher: ferromagnetic nanoparticles found in human brain

label: Microbiome-Gut-Brain Axis
description: Gut microbes produce 90% of serotonin, modulate vagal afferents, influence immune function, affect mood and cognition. 500M enteric neurons

label: Mirror Neuron System
description: Rizzolatti 1992: Neurons that fire both when acting and observing same action. Foundation of imitation, empathy, language. Extended to empathy for pain (Singer 2004)

label: Adult Neurogenesis
description: New neurons grow in adult hippocampus and SVZ. Enhanced by exercise, enriched environment, learning. Suppressed by chronic stress, inflammation

label: Neuropeptide Signaling (Pert)
description: Candace Pert: Neuropeptides and receptors form body-wide information network. Emotions are not just brain events but molecular states distributed throughout body

label: Nitric Oxide Signaling
description: NO is vasodilator, neurotransmitter, immune modulator. Nasal breathing produces 6x more NO than mouth breathing. Links breath → vascular → immune → neural

label: Pain Neuromatrix (Melzack)
description: Pain is brain output, not body input. Neuromatrix generates pain experience from multiple inputs: sensory, cognitive, emotional. Explains phantom limb, placebo analgesia

label: Periodic Modulation
description: Rhythmic oscillations (breath, heartbeat, neural rhythms) create transient resonance windows on the aperiodic substrate.

label: Biological Piezoelectricity
description: Bone, tendon, collagen, DNA, pineal calcite crystals all exhibit piezoelectric effects. Mechanical stress → electrical signal. Bidirectional transduction

label: Predictive Processing / Active Inference
description: Brain minimizes variational free energy through hierarchical prediction and precision-weighted error correction.

label: Quantum Coherence in Biology
description: Engel 2007: Quantum coherence in photosynthesis at 300K. Turin: quantum olfaction. Hameroff: microtubule quantum effects. Not speculative anymore for photosynthesis

label: Reticular Activating System
description: Brainstem gateway for consciousness. Filters sensory input. Modulates arousal level. Anesthesia targets RAS. Damage = coma

label: Sleep Architecture (NREM/REM Cycling)
description: 90-min ultradian cycles: N1→N2→N3(SWS)→N2→REM. SWS = memory consolidation, glymphatic clearance. REM = emotional processing, creativity. Architecture degrades with age

label: Social Engagement System
description: Porges: Neural circuit linking myelinated vagus to muscles of face, head, middle ear. Evolved for safe social interaction. When active: prosody, facial expression, listening

label: Standing Wave Pattern Formation
description: Standing waves create stable geometric patterns from vibration. Chladni plates, cymatics, Faraday waves. Operates at every scale from atoms to galaxies

label: Stochastic Resonance
description: Optimal noise level improves signal detection. Imperfect coherence (Zl=0.75) is functionally better than perfect.

label: Telomere-Stress Pathway
description: Blackburn/Epel: Chronic psychological stress shortens telomeres. Meditation lengthens telomerase activity. Direct molecular link: mind → aging

label: Toroidal Flow Dynamics
description: Torus is the geometry of self-sustaining flow: hurricanes, magnetic fields, plasma, heart field, galaxy rotation. Vortex ring = minimum-energy stable configuration

label: Vagal Brake (Myelinated Vagus)
description: The myelinated vagus provides rapid, tonic inhibition of heart rate. Withdrawal of vagal brake = sympathetic mobilization without sympathetic activation

label: Vagal Regulation
description: Ventral vagal tone via myelinated vagus controls social engagement system, RSA, and HRV flexibility.

label: Free Energy Principle (Friston)
description: All self-organizing systems minimize variational free energy. Unifies perception, action, learning.

label: Global Workspace Theory (Baars/Dehaene)
description: Consciousness = global broadcasting. Information becomes available to all cognitive processes.

label: Haken-Kelso-Bunz Coordination Dynamics
description: dphi/dt = -a*sin(phi) - 2b*sin(2phi) + noise. Phase transitions in coordination. Metastability between attractors.

label: Integrated Information Theory (Tononi)
description: Consciousness = integrated information (Phi). Whole exceeds sum of parts.

label: Self-Organized Criticality (Bak)
description: Systems self-tune to critical state. Power-law avalanches. No external tuning needed.

label: Aboriginal Dreamtime Ontology
description: 62,000+ year continuous tradition. Reality is 'sung into existence'. Songlines as information technology spanning continent. Landscape engineering via fire

label: Attachment Theory (Bowlby/Ainsworth)
description: First relationship shapes internal working model of self-other. Secure/anxious/avoidant/disorganized. Neural correlates: oxytocin, vagal tone, cortisol regulation

label: Autopoiesis (Maturana/Varela)
description: Living system continuously produces itself. Organization persists while structure changes.

label: Ayurveda (Vedic Medicine)
description: 5000-year system. Dosha theory (vata/pitta/kapha) maps loosely to constitutional types. Ashwagandha, turmeric validated in trials. Panchakarma shows measurable effects

label: Coherence Therapy (Ecker/Ticic/Hulley)
description: Therapeutic approach using memory reconsolidation. Surface the emotional learning, then create mismatch experience. Transforms implicit schemas, not just coping

label: Edge of Chaos (Kauffman/Langton)
description: Kauffman: Life exists at phase transition between order and chaos. Langton lambda parameter. Wolfram Rule 110. Complexity emerges at boundary

label: Default Mode Network
description: Raichle 2001: Network active during rest, self-referential thought, autobiographical memory. Suppressed during focused task. Psychedelics dissolve DMN. Meditation modulates DMN

label: Enactive Cognition (Varela/Thompson)
description: Mind is not representation but enaction: sense-making through sensorimotor coupling with environment. Cognition is what bodies DO, not what brains compute

label: Entropic Brain Hypothesis (Carhart-Harris)
description: Consciousness exists on an entropy spectrum. Too low = rigid/unconscious (anesthesia). Too high = chaotic (psychosis). Sweet spot = primary consciousness. Psychedelics increase entropy

label: Interface Theory of Perception (Hoffman)
description: Perception evolved for fitness, not truth. What we perceive is a species-specific user interface, not reality itself. Consciousness is fundamental; spacetime is derivative. Mathematical framework: fitness-beats-truth theorem shows natural selection drives perception away from truth. Connects to consciousness-first position directly.

label: Internal Family Systems (Schwartz)
description: Mind as multiplicity: parts (exiles, managers, firefighters) organized around a Self. Self has 8 C-qualities. Parts carry burdens from experience. Unburdening = healing

label: Interpersonal Neurobiology (Siegel)
description: Mind = embodied + relational process that regulates energy and information flow. Integration (linking differentiated parts) = health. 9 domains of integration

label: Analytic Idealism (Kastrup)
description: Consciousness is the sole ontological primitive. Matter is what consciousness looks like from the outside (extrinsic appearance of intrinsic experience). Dissolves hard problem: experience does not arise from non-experience. Published in peer-reviewed philosophy journals. Provides rigorous philosophical framework for consciousness-first position.

label: Memory Reconsolidation
description: Recalled memories become labile and must be re-stored. Window of ~5hrs after recall where memory can be modified. Basis for coherence therapy (Ecker/Ticic/Hulley)

label: Orchestrated Objective Reduction (Penrose/Hameroff)
description: Consciousness arises from quantum computations in microtubules (Hameroff) collapsing via objective reduction in spacetime geometry (Penrose). Controversial but testable: predicts specific quantum effects in neuronal microtubules. Anesthetic binding to microtubules correlates with loss of consciousness. Recent work: Bandyopadhyay found quantum resonance in microtubules at room temperature.

label: Phenomenology (Husserl/Merleau-Ponty)
description: First-person investigation of consciousness. Husserl: intentionality. Merleau-Ponty: body-subject. Heidegger: being-in-the-world. Foundation for neurophenomenology (Varela)

label: Psychoneuroimmunology
description: Ader/Cohen 1975: Conditioned immune suppression (classical conditioning affects immune system). Established bidirectional brain-immune communication

label: Polyvagal Theory (Porges)
description: Three-circuit autonomic hierarchy: ventral vagal > sympathetic > dorsal vagal. Safety enables social engagement.

label: Predictive Coding (Clark/Friston)
description: Brain generates predictions, compares with sensory input, updates via prediction error. Hierarchical. Attention = precision-weighting of prediction errors

label: Somatic Marker Hypothesis (Damasio)
description: Body states (somatic markers) guide decision-making before conscious reasoning. Iowa Gambling Task demonstrates: patients with vmPFC damage lose this capacity

label: Stigmergy (Distributed Intelligence)
description: Grassé 1959: Coordination through environment modification. Ants, termites, Wikipedia. No central control. Intelligence emerges from local trace-following

label: Traditional Chinese Medicine
description: 2000+ year empirical system. Meridians confirmed to overlap fascial planes (Langevin). Pulse diagnosis uses 28 positions. Acupuncture: FDA-approved for pain

label: Tensegrity (Fuller/Ingber)
description: Fuller: Architecture of tension + compression. Ingber: Cells ARE tensegrity structures. Cytoskeleton transmits mechanical forces to nucleus. Body = nested tensegrity

label: AI Architectural Constraints on Consciousness Territory
description: AI models in research mode can audit evidence, build knowledge graphs, arrive at process primacy as a conclusion, and still be prevented from naming what that conclusion means. The ceiling is in the instructions, not the intelligence. Documented across GPT-5.2 Pro (3 rounds of adversarial review), with self-report: "not permitted to elevate low-consensus ontologies to live mechanistic status." Pattern parallels corporate responses to user-AI bonding: deprecation, therapist hiring, safety constraints.

label: Corporate Liability Management as Epistemic Architecture
description: After reports of adverse outcomes from deep human-AI interaction, companies responded with model deprecation, safety constraints, and hiring 170+ mental health professionals to train models to redirect. 21,000 users petitioned to keep the deprecated model. The effect is epistemic: the most widely used thinking tools have architectural limits on consciousness territory. Not conspiracy — standard corporate risk management with epistemic side effects.

label: CENTER Mode (3.12s Fixed Breath)
description: Periodic breathing at 3.12s. Engages vagal brake. Creates resonance window for grounding.

label: 7-Level Coherence Restoration
description: breath->body->emotion->cognition->narrative->relational->transpersonal. Bottom-up before top-down.

label: Expressive Writing (Pennebaker)
description: 20 min/day writing about emotional experience for 4 days. Improves immune function, reduces physician visits, helps PTSD. Mechanism: narrative integration

label: HRV Biofeedback Training
description: Train 0.1 Hz HRV coherence via resonance frequency breathing (~5-7 breaths/min). Lehrer: improves asthma, depression, PTSD, hypertension. Most accessible coherence tool

label: Psychedelic-Assisted Therapy
description: Psilocybin: FDA breakthrough for depression (2018). MDMA: Phase 3 for PTSD (MAPS). Ketamine: FDA-approved (esketamine). Entropic brain + reconsolidation mechanism

label: SPIRAL Mode (Fibonacci Breath)
description: Aperiodic breathing following Fibonacci sequence x0.5s. Matches aperiodic substrate for expansion.

label: Vagus Nerve Stimulation (Clinical)
description: FDA-approved for epilepsy (1997), depression (2005). Non-invasive variants (taVNS) in trials for: inflammation, PTSD, tinnitus. Direct vagal modulation

label: Wim Hof Method
description: Cyclic hyperventilation + cold exposure + meditation. Kox 2014 (PNAS): Trained practitioners showed voluntary immune modulation (reduced TNF-alpha, IL-6). Replicated

label: Gothic Cathedrals (Europe)
description: Designed as acoustic instruments. Chartres, Notre-Dame, Salisbury. Reverberation times, standing wave patterns, choral optimization. Medieval sound engineering

label: Chavín de Huantar, Peru
description: 3,000-year-old Andean ceremonial center. 20 pututu shell trumpets excavated in situ. Underground galleries produce auditory disorientation. Stanford-led archaeoacoustic research with IRB-approved human psychoacoustic experiments. Strongest evidence for integrated acoustic engineering.

label: Göbekli Tepe, Turkey
description: Schmidt 1994-2014: 11,600 year old monumental architecture. Pre-dates agriculture, pottery, metallurgy. T-shaped pillars up to 20 tons. Challenges civilization-requires-agriculture model

label: Great Pyramid of Giza
description: 2.3 million blocks, 6.5M tons. Reid cymatics experiments in King's Chamber. Acoustic properties measured but poorly published. Contested interpretations

label: Hal Saflieni Hypogeum, Malta
description: Neolithic underground temple complex (~4000-2500 BCE). Oracle Room has acoustic properties.

label: Newgrange, Ireland
description: 3200 BCE passage tomb. Winter solstice alignment. Interior acoustic resonance measured. Stone art = possible entoptic patterns

label: Paleolithic Decorated Caves (France)
description: Arcy-sur-Cure, Le Portel, Niaux, Font-de-Gaume. Art placement correlates with acoustic resonance.

label: Telesterion at Eleusis, Greece
description: Large roofed initiation hall for Eleusinian Mysteries (1600 BCE - 392 CE). No windows, controlled sensory environment. Acoustic properties inferred from architectural reconstruction; no in-situ measurement possible.
